hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., major liquidation event, regulatory headline) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day avg), the subsequent 4-hour period will exhibit a mean-reverting bounce of at least 50% of the initial drop, as panic selling exhausts and algorithmic bargain-hunting amplifies the reversal.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, news-driven sell-offs in non-bear regimes often represent liquidity events rather than trend changes. High volume indicates capitulation, creating a vacuum for rapid algorithmic buying. The negative sentiment acts as a contrary indicator at extremes.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes >3% below previous close
1-hour volume > 150% of 20-day average volume for that hour
News sentiment score (from selected sources) drops below -0.7 (highly negative) within the same hour

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 1-hour drop (from the pre-drop high to the low)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new low below the initial 1-hour candle low
exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups lead to further downside (new lows) within the 4-hour window instead of a 50% retracement.
